messages.text: Hi Dr. Baldwin, I did my first testosterone injection this morning. Just wanted to confirm I'm doing this correctly - I injected 0.5mL into my thigh intramuscularly. Is that right?

Hi Jacob! Yes, that's perfect. The thigh is a great injection site for IM injections. Make sure to rotate between left and right thigh each week, or you can also use the deltoid muscle. How did the injection go? Any discomfort?
It went smoothly! A little pressure but no pain. I'm excited to see how this helps with my energy and recovery. Thanks for the quick response!
Quick question about my Semaglutide - I'm about to do my second injection. Should I rotate injection sites or can I use the same spot?

Great question! Yes, definitely rotate your injection sites. You can use abdomen, thigh, or upper arm. Try to stay at least 1 inch away from your previous injection site. This helps prevent skin irritation and ensures consistent absorption.
Also, I noticed my appetite has definitely decreased this week. Is that normal this early?

Yes, that's a great sign! Many patients notice appetite changes within the first 1-2 weeks. Make sure you're still eating enough protein to support your training - aim for at least 120-140g daily. Let me know if you have any GI symptoms like nausea.
Hi, I have a question about my Finasteride prescription. Can I take it with biotin supplements?

Hi Sarah! Yes, biotin is safe to take alongside Finasteride. Many patients find it helpful for overall hair health. You can get biotin over the counter at any pharmacy. Is there anything else I can help with?
That's great, thank you! I'll pick some up today.
Dr. Chen, I just started the Minoxidil you prescribed. I noticed some extra shedding - is this normal?

Hi Sarah! Yes, this is completely normal and actually a good sign. It's called the 'shedding phase' and typically lasts 2-4 weeks. The Minoxidil is pushing out the old, weak hairs to make room for stronger, healthier ones. Don't stop using it - this is temporary!
Hi, I just submitted my intake questionnaire. How long does it usually take for a provider to review my case?

Hi Michael! Thank you for completing your intake. Our providers typically review new cases within 24-48 hours. You'll receive a notification once your consultation is complete. In the meantime, please complete your medical questionnaire if you haven't already. Let me know if you have any questions!
